result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm Did Not Occur and Child Under 6 Years of Age

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ivan D Beck

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM Cases called: 21CM951 & 22CF180. Defendant Ivan D Beck in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Ivan D Beck.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim/Witness statute complied with. There is an agreement. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 21CM951: County Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. 
Court finds the defendant guilty in 21CM951 and orders court costs and surcharges.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 in 22CF180: Neglecting a Child - Specified Harm Did Not Occur. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts pleas. 
In 22CF180 Court holds the finding of guilty in abeyance. DAGP filed with and accepted by the Court. 40 hours of community service as part of the DAGP. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.

(Cases 21CM951, 22CF180 are called at 3:13 PM) Defendant Ivan D Beck in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Ivan D Beck.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information in 22CF180, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. 
Status Conference/Possible Plea Hearing: 07/01/2022 at 9:00 AM.

(10:05 cases 21CM951, 22CF180 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ivan D Beck in court. Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Ivan D Beck.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF180 and Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Amundson to schedule an Arraignment with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant and case 21CM951 to ride along.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 21CM951, 22CF180 are called at 10:13 AM) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ivan D Beck in court without counsel. 
Defendant is seeking counsel. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 4/18/2022 at 2:30 PM.  Hearing: 05/11/2022 at 9:30 AM.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Compliance with DHS directive.

11:29 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ivan D Beck appeared in court without counsel. Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for holding the preliminary hearing. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3-9-22 at 1:45 PM. Return to court: 3-31-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Compliance with DHS directive.
